185937714.review:
沒有中文，但是有中文化檔案，自行 Google 關鍵字可以找到。
劇情流程不長，但是關卡非常多，大部份關卡還會有兩種玩法，如果是像我一樣只想破關的話，放棄掉那些支線關卡直衝主線也是幾個小時就可以破關的。
其實我本來也是想解支線的，當然也有解了相當一部份，直到 『跟鱷魚互打音符』 那關我就決定投降了，難玩就算了還真的不好玩，耐心磨滅後我就直衝主線破關了。
還有我常常遇到一個 Bug，手把的操縱配置會突然異常，跳躍、暫停、切換…等的按鍵全部都變成別的按鍵，上網查詢沒發現有人跟我一樣的狀況，我用的是 XBOX 手把用無線連接，Steam 設置裡的手把輸入我有關閉，只用遊戲本身預設的配置也是會遇到，希望這只是我個人的問題。
總而言之，有折扣的話非常建議入手，雖然有的關卡蠻刁鑽；讓我玩得很不爽，但實屬良作，推。

185490076.review:
Absolutely one of my favourite sonic games ever made. Period. Loved it back when I first played it when I was six and I still love it now. The boost gameplay is the great highlight as it was in unleashed but with further improvements, and classic sonic while not having genesis-accurate physics (definitely not at the level of sonic 4 lol) is still a lot of fun. If you do end up getting bored of the main-game content there are over a decade's worth of mods that you can try out to add more content to the game.

But enough about shilling, play Sonic Generations. It's probably one of the best Sonic games to have come out during the 2010's, and a lot of fun.

I honestly can’t see why people praise this game. It’s super frustrating, controls are sluggish and the game is also full of artificial playtime extenders (collectibles, uninteresting challenges etc). The sections in 2D are ok, but the third person ones are crazily bad. Your worst enemy is camera and hit boxes, together with bad game design choices. Maybe the console version was better and it’s just a bad pc port, dunno. I played it on steam deck, and the game feels very bad on its controller. Not to mention bizarre bugs and freezes. Oh yeah, the frame rate and resolution are very low, doesn’t matter what machine you’re running the game on. Don’t buy this and stay away, honestly.  
Maybe the remake is better, I dunno.

185414776.review:
Um grande marco na franquia Sonic, sendo um dos melhores jogos da franquia até hoje. Simplesmente uma ótima homenagem a todos que são fãs da franquia (principalmente pra quem é das antigas), cada estágio e remix de música são maravilhosos e dão aquele sensação de nostalgia.
É uma pena que ainda tenha muitas outras fases que mereciam uma participação nesse game e infelizmente não apareceram, mas em contrapartida, a SEGA fez esse jogo levar a franquia ao topo de novo (ao lado de Sonic Unleashed), sendo ele um jogo em comemoração aos 20 anos de Sonic, acertaram em cheio na criação do game e na divisão de gameplay dos Sonics.
Como a SEGA na época passava por grandes problemas, seja tanto em lançamentos como o Sonic 06 (famoso delírio coletivo kkkkkkk), quanto em inovar a gameplay e não conseguir agradar todo o público da franquia, essa foi uma ótima maneira de tentar unir a comunidade pra comemorar juntos o aniversário do azulão mesmo com a mudança ao passar dos anos. Misturar a gameplay pros jogadores experimentar seja a gameplay antiga e também a mecânica de boost do Sonic moderno, essa foi uma ótima maneira de mostrar como Sonic hoje em dia pode inovar e que não precisa ficar sempre sendo um estilo único de Gameplay.
Também esse foi o momento em que a SEGA começou a agradar os fãs antigos quanto os novos, com a divisão de lançamentos de jogos em 2D quanto em 3D para os 2 tipos de públicos, sendo essa uma boa decisão pra mostrar o quão importante os 2 estilos representam Sonic.

Em resumo, esse jogo foi e ainda é muito importante pra franquia e é um excelente jogo até hoje, apesar de ser um pouco curto pelo fato de se poder zerar em um dia, ainda gera algumas horas a mais de gameplay com desafios pra pegar colecionáveis e upgrades, com uma história mediana mas esse não sendo um foco e sim um motivo de passado e presente se encontrarem. Eu particularmente amo esse jogo e já zerei incontáveis vezes, e até hoje as vezes eu volto nele pra jogar algumas fases que eu gosto e ouvir as músicas que eu amo ouvir. Pra quem é fã é um prato cheio e com certeza irá se divertir muito.

[b] NOTA:[/b] 9

185410944.review:
i'm developing this odd habit of getting really into games after they've been delisted and condemned to the Disney Vault forever but this one has a HD Remake so, whatever,

Good overall. Solid 6.7 out of 10 installment accounting for age. It's a Sonic game so the soundtrack alone mostly makes up for that, and like any good Sonic game it has a sound test. Some of the bonus tracks are looped badly but you'll get over it.

It's a game that's entirely fair to just play to the end credits and shelf it, but it's [i]possible[/i] to get good at playing, and feel like you're getting good at it, if you're invested enough to overcome the jank. There is so, so, so much jank. The designers are entirely aware of what they did and lean into it in places; most of the series since SA2B has some form of "hard mode" backroom where the level designers look you in the eye and empty an entire pepper shaker of jank on your plate and make you eat it like a dog.

Some of what's here really earns that 6/10. i'm not a huge fan of how sluggish the vertical 3D parts are, or how fiddly the on-rails 3D parts are, or how floaty the 2D parts are, or the transitions between 3D/2.5D/2D sections, or the sporadic lack of control precision when it matters. Boss fights often feel like you're interacting by putting notes in a suggestions box and hoping they get acted on. Final boss in particular feels like you're controlling the game with a 5 second stream delay and nothing seems to do anything until it does and you can't figure out why.

Every “Modern” game in this franchise i've played (besides Mania, which isn't really Sega's work) has a secret, miserable post-game megaboss you have to beat for 100% completion: the menu system. The online/time-attack mode in this one is extra painful and if you want that simple-looking "play all levels in time attack" achievement, you [i]will[/i] spend more time waiting for screens of text to load than actually playing the levels. The chevo for no-hit final boss requires you to repeatedly precision-QTE-mash through 8 seconds of loading and fmv screens to retry, or worse get to the end in a fail state and have to hold skip for 2 minutes in the credits - a successful run requires iterating like this to develop clairvoyant Hidden Object Game skills to even understand what's happening on screen, because see above paragraph about the total lack of feedback. It's almost a rite of passage that the game makes you navigate these dark corners, but it's so unnecessary. Could've been executed much better.

For all its warts, i don't regret grinding out 100% completion at all. The gallery room is cool. Sega ought to go back and pay all its musicians fair dues so we can have more like this in future.

185341646.review:
I really do think that this game is a ton of fun and one of the best sonic game that I've played imo. I was hoping a seamless experience y'know like 60 fps capped with no fps drop but MAN this game, by itself, has A LOT of stuttering when I play as Modern Sonic (and Classic Sonic sometimes). The game is fun when the player moves fast and it kinda is the whole point of the game. However, the stuttering can get way too distracting at certain times. There is that one time I lost the timing on a jump that made me fail to get the S rank in that one city level (I forgot the name). 

Also, SEGA, why did you delist the game from steam? I get that you want people to buy the new and shiny SONIC X SHADOW GENERATIONS game, but why remove the original? Personally, I don't think that putting the game only available to buy in a bundle that costs Rp 673 200 (around 50 USD) and not putting it up for sale individually is a great idea. Maybe I just don't get it. You do you SEGA, you do you.

Overall, I think that the game here is still fun in a way that is still jank (other reviewers may point that out). The levels are super fun, challenging and a nice tribute to older Sonic games in general. And the music, like, THE MUSIC is GOATED man. The Sonic Team really nails the music part of this game especially the one from Speed Highway that one is my fav. 

Try the original one if you really don't mind buying the bundle. Otherwise just stick to the new SONIC X SHADOW GENERATIONS game and look up the difference between the original and the new one (there are quite a few changes)

185272823.review:
This game is peak, but before I begin glazing this game, just a reminder about this bundle: It is [u] grossly overpriced [/u].I love Adventure 1 and 2, and I’d say they're mostly worth their prices, as is Generations. Sonic 4 episode 2 is overpriced, but fine enough. However, Sonic 4 Episode 1 is a complete [b] trash-tier [/b] videogame and not even worth a fraction of its price. They should be PAYING [i] you [/i] to play it. This bundle just exists to get you to pay for both Sonic 4 eps. Their collective price really inflates the cost of the whole bundle. This collection of games just isn’t worth it at this price. Wait for a 25% sale or something. At least then you can take it as an opportunity to buy Adventure 1 and 2, if you haven’t already. 

If you Just wanna play generations, and are willing to pay upwards of 50? Just get SxS Gens. It’s the complete package, and has the best new Sonic experience since the OG Generations in 2011. 
(in light of how much i dislike this bundle, i probably should have made my review negative, but i just couldn't do that to Generations)

[h3] This game Is one of the greatest 3d platformers ever made [/h3] and I played it to near death on my series x (it has a 60fps boost on there). There’s 11 awesome levels (not Planet Wisp) with 2 main ‘acts’ each, with a bunch of bonus levels and bosses for each area. By mixing the boost gameplay and classic gameplay, each level feels distinct from one another and are all worth individual replays. Sure, there’s a bit much 2d, but it tends to serve the levels well, as most levels are superbly paced and tightly designed, to the point where you can easily play a level for hours and hours and still discover better routes (I only recently learned that you can run across the water at the start of seaside hill to reach a shortcut). 

On average, this game may take 5-7 hours to complete the main levels, and maybe 15 hours if you wanted to complete everything. Considering just how short and sweet each level is, that completion time is definitely worth shooting for. And between the dozens of great stage mods (namely, the Unleashed project), you can easily clock hundreds of hours into this. On that note, it is definitely worthwhile to get this version of the game, old as it may be (i mean, it’s got a crusty launcher). Y’see a lot of the older mods may never be ported to the new Sonic gens remaster, ‘cos a lot of modders have probably left the scene since their mods were created.  Either way, since Shadow gens is so new, the focus is probably gonna be on modding for his campaign, instead of porting mods to Sonic gens. So chances are, it'll still be worth it to own this copy of the game, even years from now. 

(this is more subjective, but i also dislike the blue filter SxS gens smeared all over Sonic’s levels. Like, it ain’t too bad, but i really notice it in Green hill and Speed Highway)

Très bon jeu Sonic, un réel plaisir de pouvoir jouer à la fois au Sonic 3D et 2D, les niveaux s'enchaînes sans peines, le jeu est fluide, on a une réelle impression de vitesse surtout sur les niveaux 3D.

184796365.review:
This game is semi-delisted from Steam, as in you can no longer buy it as a stand alone title, but you can still get it through bundles which will probably costs you 50 or 100$ so whether or not you wanna do is upto you. This was in favour of the fact Sonic X Shadow Generations already had this game + second Shadow campaign. 

This shouldn't go without saying, but I highly recommend playing this game with a controller. I mean playing it with a keyboard is fine, but it's just smoother to play with a controller. Also make sure, to get a good quality one, certain controllers just suck because it causes 3D Sonic to just swing left constantly for some reason.

[h1] The gameplay [/h1]

this game is split into to sections

Modern Sonic - he has the boost formula, and of course his signature homing attack. His part is easily the best part of the game it's fun, and it makes you feel fast. He also has his 2D sections which personally, is better than Classic Sonic stages for me. 

Classic Sonic - he plays like he did in the Genesis games, but for me personally, he just feels odd. He doesn't feel like how he did in the Genesis games, however he's still fun to play as his own thing and better than he was in Forces. 

The bosses of the game are fun too, I like  Silver and Metal Sonic. 


[h1] Music [/h1]

It's a Sonic game, so of course the music slaps. My favorite is City Escape Act 1. 

[h1] Story [/h1]

The story of this game is simple, a creature kidnaps Sonic and his friends, and it's your job to save the day again with Sonic and past Sonic. 

[h1] Customizablity [/h1]

This game has mods, and a lot of them so after you're done playing the campaign and 100%ing the game you can still replay the game because of what the modding community offers.



[h1] Final thoughts [/h1]

This game is actually very very solid, and it's very fun. It's a shame you really can't get it anymore, but hey if you wanna get it you  can just buy the bundles, or get it's remake with Shadow X Sonic Generations.

184789263.review:
this one is easily the best sonic game ive played so far - the classic levels are whatever, im not into 2d sonic so i will not comment.

nearly all the 3d levels are smooth and silky with lots of shortcuts to go faster through the levels once you know how, the only downside is how many times the game grinds to a halt when the 3d levels become 2d, and you have to slowly navigate platforms. this is a chore that hits its peak at the final level (the sonic colors stage), hardly any of this stage is even 3d, it may as well be 2 2d levels

overall good game if not a little bit too easy as the game plays itself a lot of the time

184782434.review: Great game overall, perfect entry point into the series.

184734508.review:
Sonic Generations é um jogo essencialmente divertido. Não é um jogo com muitas valências diferenciadas, como um super enredo e/ou uma trilha sonora marcante e emocionante, restringindo seu enfoque a uma proposta específica de gameplay com personagens consagrados aos gamers. Trata-se, sobretudo, de um game pra você se divertir e nisso, o objetivo é plenamente atingido.

Não dá nem pra se falar em enredo/história, afinal ele existe apenas como plano de fundo e nem tem como ser diferente. O que dá pra se falar é da variedade de missões, níveis e diferentes coisas pra se fazer. Cada missão tem dois tipos de gameplay, o que impede que o jogo se torne maçante. Além disso, o jogo não te obriga a fazer diversas missões diferentes para progredir na quest principal, o que favorece quem não gosta de um nível em específico. 

Os cenários são bonitos e o level design muito bem feito. A variação dos níveis e dos obstáculos e ferramentas à disposição favorece demais a gameplay e a diversão do jogador. A trilha sonora padrão do Sonic também combina bem com a gameplay e com a proposta do título, tornando tudo bem orquestrado para funcionalidade do jogo.

Como pontos negativos, menciono apenas a má adaptação dos controles ao PC (teclado) e a otimização. O jogo constantemente tem queda de frames e travamentos, sem contar que a própria inicialização é problemática.

De toda forma, em questões gerais, Sonic Generations é um jogo excelente, que passa muito da sensação de infância dos jogos clássicos do Sonic. Sem dúvida é um título que vale a pena jogar, tanto para o novo público, quanto para os saudosistas de uma outra era dos videogames.

Já no sonic 2 do MegaDrive é o melhor sonic clássico que por sua vez NÃO combina com essa jogabilidade mordena 3D. o Fps cagado deixa a experiencia pior ainda. Alem da pessima resposta nos comandos. A UNICA coisa boa do jogo são as musicas.

184505146.review: Sonic Generations is arguably the BEST Sonic game that the franchise offers. Smooth controls, stunning visuals, fantastic level design, and amazing gameplay - players will want to come back and replay the game over and over again. This is a great Sonic game that celebrates the character and will ensure that Sonic fans new and old will have a great time.

184480233.review:
Great platformer. So from my understanding this is pretty much a compilation of the best parts of the previous games remade into one game + with some extras of its own. The main levels are all amazing. And the game has dozens and dozens of extra levels. 122 stages in total, which is insane. Although gigantic amount of stages I never got bored. All of those extra stages are parts taken from the main levels with some extra condition added, but do not get fooled, even though you play through the same environments they often altered the layouts or completely changed the gameplay. This is how you reuse levels, so many games do it so lazily, but here all of the reused level design feels like completely new levels. It is truly amazing how much variety there is in those stages. There are a few stinkers there and there though, it would be silly to expect all 122 stages to be good, but to my surprise there are only about 10 bad ones, and usually because they do not have any checkpoints even though they could, and they usually have just a single tight and poorly designed part in them, but it is painful and completely kills the level.

One major problem I have with this game is that controls are quite broken, at times unresponsive, do not register my commands. This problem is pretty constant, the biggest offender is auto aim. The distance and angle by with you have to be from the object is very unclear, sometimes I'm nearby the object and there is no aim sign, other times I'm far from the object and there is aim sign. This ended in many deaths. Another problem is how often I confuse straight boosting and aimed jumps, or more precisely how the game forces me to misuse them. This usually happens when I should jump to something aimed, but the game does not register aiming, but when I use boost it jumps to the wrong direction or plain through... Often into an abyss. Walking controls are very odd, at first they are too slow, very clunky and you feel super immobile, but after just a few steps you become too fast and can't control yourself with precision anymore. It uses speed acceleration for movement. It's always either too slow or too fast and could have easily been fixed by having non-increasing walking speed which is of medium speed and you only gain speed by boosting or ramps or ground boosters. About unresponsiveness, sometimes I can see the aim sign, but I still can't jump to it, sometimes you can see it even if you're not close enough which can be annoying, usually happens with bosses.

Besides movement problems there are also a lot of game breaking glitches. Many times something did not trigger and I had to restart the game for it to work properly. For example, those gears that require gems did not begin to work once I added gems to them. One of them began to spin very slowly (way too slow) and the others did not budge, but after I restarted the game all of them were spinning on the proper speed. All of the game breaking glitches were fixed after restarting the game, so at least that is a solace.


7/10

184172516.review:
Completed as of writing this review: All Achievements

A very good celebration of the series! I really enjoyed this game since childhood and still like it now but my overall opinion soured a bit after replaying it 100% yet again in the remaster. The plot is pretty simple, nothing that much interesting, though it's weird how Classic Sonic doesn't talk while Classic Tails does. It makes it seem like Sonic was dumber back then. It also adds some loopholes to the lore of the series, mainly the 06's inclusion. 

The stages are very good and feel like true remakes, as if what would've happened if the originals were released today or in 2011. Though Planet Wisp as Normal Sonic is too long. Classic's stages feel good too and are an interesting "demake" of the stages from the 3D games. Normal Sonic's physics and controls are better than Unleashed and Colors, though developers can't decide whether he should have a double jump or a jumpdash. And classic is not a perfect one to one port of the physics but good enough. The bosses are also very cool and that's interesting to see how they have their own interpretations of gameplay. However, the final boss is one of, if not the worst Final Boss in the series. 

My main problem though is with challenge gates. If we're talking about beating the game, it's fine to just choose one and go further. But if we're talking 100%, they are very uninspired and to be honest I would've preferred 1 or 2 more stages than all of those missions, as some of them feel like padding, for example the doppelganger ones. The exploration for Red Star Rings was pretty interesting but not to the extent of Colors level design, where some of them had their own areas.

The PC port is very sub-par and it was unoptimized for it's time. We all know the infamous Configuration Tool error. The tool itself is very barebones and useless essentially. The controller can get buggy if you're not using Steam's emulation of XInput or the XInput controller. At least we can thank this port for one of the most advanced modding scenes in the series. Really interesting move to release it for PC at all after not releasing previous games to the platform for many years. 

As a whole, this game is good but not the best 3D Sonic in the series, like many fans think. You can't call a collection of stages' remakes a best game in the series, it's essentially cheating. But I highly recommend you to play, especially if you are a fan of the previous games.

184092393.review:
Sonic Generations is one of the best iterations of the boost Sonic gameplaystyle that exists!

You can definitely see that it is a bit older nowadays, the graphics aren't as crisp as you will see in newer titles, but the game itself still plays and looks very good!

It is very easy and simple to get into aswell, so its a treat for newcomers and veterans alike!

In this game you play as either modern or classic sonic. While I do prefer the modern style, this games classic sonic isn't too bad, it controls pretty good, even if not perfect compared to the classic 2d games. Definitely plays a lot better than in forces, thats for sure!

Ths spindash of classic sonic is very overpowered here and if you jump just after spindashing and hold the stick in just the right direction, you'll be flying over very large portions of the stages. It feels very nice to do so, but it is sad that you don't really see much of a stage that way. The normal gameplay is fun too, so I'd recommend everyone to try and find all the red rings!

This holds true for modern Sonic aswell, the controls are very nice, though I do gotta say, if you played newer titles, it feels like a doublejump is missing. The stages are made without that in mind though, so its all pretty much just an issue of having gotten used to something even more... heh, modern.

The stagedesign for both Sonics are nice, I really like the challenges aswell and I think the only way to play this, is to try and get an S rank on everything, it isn't that hard in this game!

You will definitely have fun playing through this, even if it is a little bit dated by now!

183882948.review:
4/10
I grew up playing sonic and loved it. Looking back on it, I think I loved it because thats really all I had to play. The main problem with sonic is that his key feature is being fast. Its hard to make interesting game play when all you are doing is running really fast. 

I think this game was done really well for a sonic game. It has a lot of variety, a ton of different challenges, and lots of different characters. I think if you could play as a couple different characters that are not based around speed, this would be more interesting. The game could have more variety. 

I think that people that really enjoy sonic games will like this game, but I think this game has taught me that sonic games are just not for  me.

183660906.review:
Awesome game with classic and modern Sonic mechanics, with a collection of different Sonic game acts remade. The story is not bad at all considering that they had to create an excuse for those different acts, although the final boss battle is really chaotic the first time you get to it (pro tip: [spoiler]dash all the time and switch to classic only when the boss beams the laser, then return.[/spoiler]).

I'm not a fan of collectables though, the Red Rings were a pain already in Sonic 4 episode 2, and just like that time, I got the chievo thanks to the video tutorials that show exactly where they are located. Friends also give you their location when you talk to them about Red Rings. 

Planet WISP acts are weird until you get used too, specially the classic Sonic stage. That transformation really kills the flow of the game IMO. Challenges make the playtime increase by a lot, and if you want to play even more, just S rank everything, challenges included (not necessary for the S rank achievement -only the acts count).

As of now, online achievements still work, although it may glitch and crash the game when you try to select a stage (Chemical Act2 in my case, thanks God it glitched when saving once I finished it and it counted, because I couldn't even select it afterwards).
